greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Filter sequence: All prime powers p^k, k >= 1, are allotted to distinct equivalence classes according to their exponent k, while all other numbers occur in singular equivalence classes of their own.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A305974.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
program: partialsums(f,up_to) = { my(v = vector(up_to), s=0); for(i=1,up_to,s += f(i); v[i] = s); (v); }

rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 02 2018
